001package com.technototes.library.hardware.sensor.encoder;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.AnalogInput;
004import com.technototes.library.hardware.sensor.Sensor;
005
006/**
007 * A wrapper around an AnalogInput that enables "zeroing" for usefulness
008 */
009public class ExternalEncoder extends Sensor<AnalogInput> implements Encoder {
010
011    private double zero = 0;
012    private double val = 0;
013
014    /**
015     * Create an ExternalEncoder from an arbitrary AnalogInput
016     *
017     * @param device the AnalogInput device
018     */
019    public ExternalEncoder(AnalogInput device, String nm) {
020        super(device, nm);
021    }
022
023    /**
024     * Create an ExternalEncoder from an arbitrary AnalogInput device
025     *
026     * @param deviceName the name of the AnalogInput device
027     */
028    public ExternalEncoder(String deviceName) {
029        super(deviceName);
030    }
031
032    @Override
033    public String LogLine() {
034        return logData(String.format("%f1.3 (raw: %f1.3)", val - zero, val));
035    }
036
037    /**
038     * Set the current device value as "zero"
039     */
040    @Override
041    public void zeroEncoder() {
042        AnalogInput device = getRawDevice();
043        if (device != null) {
044            zero = device.getVoltage();
045        }
046    }
047
048    /**
049     * Get the sensor value (relative to the assigned zero)
050     *
051     * @return the value of the input
052     */
053    @Override
054    public double getSensorValue() {
055        AnalogInput device = getRawDevice();
056        if (device != null) {
057            val = device.getVoltage();
058        }
059        return val - zero;
060    }
061}
